statement.tex:
%text Fuel expenditure for a steam-ship are proportional to the cube of its speed. It is known that a speed of 10 km/h, fuel costs are ₹ 240/hour. Other expenses (independent of speed) amount to ₹ 480 per hour.
At what speed should the ship travel to keep its \underline\text{total expenses per kilometre} lowest? And what will the \underline\text{total expense per hour} be? %
\\ %text Given the speed (s) of the boat, the fuel expense per hour $(F_H)$ and the total expense per hour $(T_H)$, \underline\text{which of the following is true}? %
\\ \textbf{Total expenditure per kilometre?} \\ \text{Given the total expenditure per hour, what}\\ \text{will be the }\underline{\text{total expenditure per km }(T_K)}?
\\ %text Now that the captain of the ship knows the formula for total expense per kilometre, he calculates the optimal speed and resulting expense as follows. \textbf{Has he calculated correctly?} %

reason.tex: \begin{align} T_K &= \left(\dfrac{6}{25}s^2 + \dfrac{480}{s}\right) \\ \implies\dfrac{d T_K}{ds} &= \dfrac{12}{25}s - \dfrac{480}{s^2} \\ \text{and }\dfrac{d^2 T_K}{ds^2} &= \dfrac{12}{25} + \dfrac{960}{s^3} \\ \text{Now }\dfrac{dT_K}{ds} &= 0\text{ when }\dfrac{12}{25}s = \dfrac{480}{s^3} \\ \implies s^3 &= 1000\text{ or } s = 10\text{ km/h} \\ \text{Also, }\dfrac{d^2 T_K}{ds^2} &\gt 0\text{ for all }s\gt 0\implies\text{ minima.} \end{align} \\ \text{Hence, the expense per km is minimum at}\\ \text{10 km/hour. And at that speed, the}\\ \underline{\text{expense per hour}}\text{ would be }\\ \quad T_H(10) = \dfrac{6}{25}\cdot 10^3 + 480 = ₹ 720/hr.
